course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Fundamental Organic Chemistry Laboratory
course.description: This is the laboratory course designed for non-CHEM students who enrolled in CHEM 2110 or CHEM 2111. Students will perform a series of organic experiments related to the theories learnt in the related lecture courses. Students will be trained to practice a wide range of fundamental organic laboratory techniques, operate chemical instruments, relate the physical and chemical principles and theory in practice, and develop their data interpretation and analytical skills. For non-CHEM students in programs that designate this course as required course/specified elective only.
course.prerequisites: (CHEM 1010 OR CHEM 1020) AND CHEM 1050
course.corequisites: CHEM 2110 OR CHEM 2111
course.exclusions: CHEM 2150, CHEM 2550

reviews.author: ggg_
reviews.title: 1 credit graded course
reviews.comment_content:
5 experiments in total this semester.
(1) Recrystallization of Organic Solids
(2) Distillation of Organic Liquids
(3) Isolation of an Organic Component from a Mixture
(4) Organic Synthesis
(5) Characterization of organic compounds
Basic organic laboratory techniques and principles behind, related to Organic Chemistry I.
reviews.comment_teaching: Unlike general chemistry laboratory, the briefing session introducing principles of the experiments to be done is uploaded onto Canvas as video rather than held in the lab live before conducting experiments, and it's better that you watch it before going to the lab. (It is categorized under the assignment page, which is weird) Another footage showing procedures of the experiments is also available, which allows you to familiarize yourself with what to do. The instructor will demonstrate the operations before you start to do it yourself in the lab session, but I still recommend you watch both videos and read the manual before actually attending.
reviews.comment_grading:
NOT P/F!!! graded :(
Don't know whether the grading is good or not, no statistics.
5% Safety assignment
30% Lab Performance
30% Lab Report
35% Examination

safety assignment: 5/5
report1: 29.12/30
report2: 26.9/30
report3: 24.49/30
report4: 23.72/30
report5: 28.4/30
(among the five reports, only one is higher than upper quartile, others equal to or slightly lower than upper quartile)
exp performance: 30/30
final: 41/50
(upper quartile 31, high 43, mean 28.29)
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The worksheet is divided into two parts, the first two part for recording experimental data, some calculations (e.g. recovery percentage) and the second part for some more in-depth questions regarding the mechanisms and principles. The briefing video will be needed in this part, and it's safer if you check your answer with friends before handing in. Also don't forget to attach the original data sheet with TA signature as it will result in mark deduction, although there is no reserved place for it in the worksheet. (weird again)
The final exam is kinda difficult... composed of 40 MC (40 points) and several short questions (10 points), and only one hour is given, which is quite tight. The short questions test on your understanding of the principles behind each experiment, (comparing hydrophobicity, separating compounds from mixtures, etc.) as well as some details that you have no idea that they will test on (e.g. which material is some parts of the IR liquid cell made of). Some questions are also similar to those in the worksheet, so make sure you understand the worksheet questions and everything in the briefing video if you want to score high in the exam.

reviews.author: Leon2002
reviews.title: Study the tutorial videos and lab videos hard
reviews.comment_content:
Lab 1 — Recrystallization of organic solids

Lab 2 — Distillation of organic liquids

Lab 3 — Isolation of an Organic Component from a mixture
• Liquid-liquid extraction of organic components from a mixture  
• Isolation / purification of organic components

Lab 4 —  Organic synthesis
• Nucleophilic substitution

Lab 5 — Characterisation of organic compounds  
• Melting point measurement
• Infra-red spectroscopy of organic compounds

Comments: Quite practical and highly related to things learnt in Organic Chemistry I
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dennis teaches clearly in tutorial videos and he is able to answer students’ questions in lab sessions.

The lab videos can show the procedure and results of the experiment explicitly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Safety Assignment: 10%
Quizzes: 30%
Lab Reports: 45%
Final exam (semester end): 15%

My grades:
Safety Assignment: 42/42

Expt1 — Report: 40.5/45
          — Lab Quiz: 6/7

Expt2 — Report: 42.18/45
          — Lab Quiz: 7/7

Expt3 — Report: 37.8/45
          — Lab Quiz: 6/7

Expt4 — Report: 31.4/45
          — Lab Quiz: 1/7

Expt5 — Report: 42.1/45
          — Lab Quiz: 3/7

Final exam: 34/45

Final Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Safety Assignment to finish at the start of the semester
— quite easy as answers are all provided in the Safety video. You just need to be careful and observant to find out all the answers.

5 lab reports and 5 lab quizzes to finish throughout the semester.
—The first half of a lab report is easy and answers are all provided in the lab videos and information from MSDS on CANVAS. Some simple calculation or drawings of reaction mechanisms
— The second half of the lab report gets tricky. You have to apply the concepts learnt from tutorial videos/ Organic Chemistry/ General Chemistry to answer the short questions.
— the quizzes have a medium difficulty. To get high marks, study and understand the tutorial videos, the lab videos and the lab manual.

The final exam is a regurgitation of the quizzes. To get high marks, study the quizzes and rewatch the tutorial videos and make notes. Make sure you understand all the concepts.
